author: Business and Finance
title: GALLERY: CEO 100 launch
text:
Business | Thu 15   Ian Hyland, Business & Finance; Richard Moat, eir; and Gerard Corcoran, AIB Private Banking Business leaders gathered in Dublin last night as Business & Finance launched its CEO 100, proudly sponsored by AIB Private Banking . 
100 organisations, running the full gamut of Irish business life. 100 different ways of doing things. 100 snapshots of the Irish economy at this critical point in time. 
Whatever way you look at the Business & Finance CEO 100 reveals much about life and work in Ireland today. Some of the companies that these CEOs lead are reassuringly familiar – like Largo Foods, the maker of Tayto; fruit giant Fyffes, and Guinness stalwart Diageo. 
Some companies could barely have been dreamed of until a few years ago, like STATSports, which tracks the movement and health of professional athletes on the field of play, and is now standard issue in the English Premiership and in international rugby. 
There are plenty of familiar figures in this year’s CEO 100, and surnames inextricably linked with Irish business: Smurfit, O’Reilly, O’Leary. Likewise, companies that have been around for generations. 
In a highly disruptive business environment, where technology causes fortunes to ebb and flow; empires to rise and fall faster than ever before, one wonders which of these leaders has the vision to match the old guard’s longevity.
